refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns the number of channels in a stored function table.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns the number of channels in a stored function table.

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: Returns the number of channels of a GEN01 table, determined from the header of the original file. If the original file has no header or the table was not created by these GEN01, ftchnls returns -1.

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para:
Here is an example of the ftchnls opcode. It uses the files ftchnls.csd, mary.wav, and kickroll.wav.
Example of the ftchnls opcode.
See the sections Real-time Audio and Command Line Flags for more information on using command line flags.
The audio file mary.wav is monophonic, the audio file kickroll.wav is stereophonic, so its output should include lines like these:
instr 1: ichnls = 1.000 instr 1: ichnls = 2.000
